plugins.description:
Utopia is a systematic approach to fluid type and space design. This plugin generates named type styles and space components from a handful of editable values. This kickstarts your design project with a palette of related building blocks for use at your minimum and maximum viewport widths.


The purpose of the plugin is to automate the laborious process of creating and organising an initial set of components and styles.


If you prefer, you can configure your type and space scales at utopia.fyi and paste the resulting URL into this plugin.


Values can be edited by running the plugin again. Changes made to the generated type styles will persist as long as the styles are not renamed. For instance you can change the font in Figma and re-run the plugin without the text reverting back to the default font. To reset everything, delete the artboards and the U/ style folder.

plugins.name: Valor

plugins.description:
Variable fonts, now in Figma!


A plugin to provide basic variable fonts support through samsa.js.


This plugin enables you to:

  • Render variable fonts as graphics on the Figma canvas
  • Preview, create, and edit/update these graphics
  • Choose from all the axes in a variable font
  • Choose from all the variable fonts available from Google Fonts


Usage


You should see the Variable Fonts palette appear, similar to the screenshot above.


  • Pick one of the dozens of variable fonts available from Google Fonts.
  • In the Preview section, enter some custom text.
  • Set the color and axes values you want.
  • Then click the Add button at the top of the Preview section.


This will add a Vector graphic object to your Figma canvas.


That result is a normal Figma Vector object that you can do all the normal things you can typically do with such objects.


It is NOT a Text object!


Do you have a bug, feature request, or improvement? Submit a PR or file an issue here: https://github.com/Tgemayel/variable-fonts-figma/issues
plugins.name: Variable Fonts

plugins.description:
This plugin adds support for variable-width stroke to Figma. To use:


  1. Draw a stroke with the pen tool.
  2. Select the stroke.
  3. Run this plugin.
  4. Edit the stroke within the plugin window. This lets you adjust the stroke thickness.


Because Figma plugins cannot directly augment Figma's editing tools, variable-width stroke is only editable within this plugin's window. Once you edit an object using this plugin, the stroke will be "outlined" (i.e. be replaced by a fill) when you go back to Figma. It's still possible to edit the variable-width stroke object again after closing the plugin by selecting the object and re-running this plugin.


More detailed instructions are available in this plugin's help menu.
plugins.name: Variable-Width Stroke

plugins.description:
Create global variables and link them to any property across any layer. Experiment with your designs, keep organized, and unlock new functionality within Figma.


ğŸ“• Playground and documentation

Start by duplicating this handy file in the community! Check out interactive lessons and documentation, and see how variables can transform the way you work in Figma.


âœ… Features

  • Use variables to control nearly 50 layer properties like blurs, shadows, size, rotation, text, padding, and much more.
  • Use combo variables to modify your existing variables with math. For example, set a variable to be the value of another variable divided by 2, or multiply two of your variables together.
  • Change variable scope to work for you. Have a different set of variables for each page in a document, share variables across the whole document, or even use one set of variables for all your documents.
  • Batch edit specific properties, like blur, shadow offset, and contrast, across different images or shadows without requiring the other properties to match.
  • Realtime syncing for multiple editors. Add, modify, or delete a variable and your changes will automatically sync to all users.


ğŸ¤” How to use

Thatâ€™s really up to you! Variables and linked properties work together to do whatever you want. At the bare minimum, you create a variable in the Variables tab. You can then use that variable to link it to the same property across different layers. Or different properties on the same layer. Or any combination you can dream up. Go wild! For inspiration, check out the playground and documentation file.


â˜•ï¸ Support the plugin

If you love the plugin and feel inclined to provide some small financial support to encourage the development of new features and bug fixes, that would be greatly appreciated. No pressure, of course!

Buy me a coffee


ğŸš§ Roadmap

  • The option for layers with linked variables to be automatically updated when you rename a variable.
  • Variable value previews in the Properties tab
  • Much more!


_

plugins.description:
The Variant Switcher plugin recursively changes component instances to a different variant based on the specified property.


If you have a lot of different components in your design system that share a same property (e.g., "theme"), you can use this plugin to switch them to the same property value (e.g., "theme=dark theme").


Usage

The Variant Switcher plugin has three input fields:

  • Property Name: the property you want to change
  • From Variant: (Optional) the current value you want to target (leave blank to select all instances with the selected property regardless of the current value)
  • To Variant: the new value you want to set the property
  • Deep Switch: When unchecked, the plugin will not switch children after switching parent instance. (Diagram explanation)


Contact Us

  • ğŸ›Bugs report or feature request? https://github.com/pxblue/figma-plugins/issues
  • âœ‰ï¸General inquiries? pxblue@eaton.com
  • â¤ï¸ Visit our home page! pxblue.github.io

  2. Randomizer: you can randomize values for the number of rows, columns, padding, cell-size, allowing you to easily explore.

Note: the randomizer function will only create square matrices - which means the number of columns equals the number of rows.

plugins.description:
Version History â†’ Slack

Or VHS for short, sends version info from your Figma documents to your custom Slack Webhook. A comprehensive step-by-step guide is available in the Community.


How to use VHS â“

  1. Run plugin;
  2. Provide the requested information:â€¨Slack Webhook URL, Figma API Token, Figma Document URL, and Document Name;
  3. Select the desired Date Format, and Date Separator;
  4. Press â€œGet versionsâ€;
  5. The plugin will display the 5 most recent versions with info details;
  6. Click on the version you want to send to Slack;
  7. If successful, the Slack Webhook should treat the information according to the defined Workflow.


The plugin has 3 options:

  • Date Format: select your preference for date formatting;
  • Date Separator: pick a character to separate the date;
  • Keep window open: If switched on, the plugin window will remain open after sending a message. You will be able to pick another version to send to Slack.


Use Cases ğŸ”¨

  • Share Design System updates in a Slack Channel;
  • Send yourself a log of changes of an important project;
  • Inform a colleague of recent changes to a file you are working on together;
  • Keep track of different proposals;
  • Log the evolution of a project in a Google Sheet;
  • Pass the version info to Zapier;
  • Anything else you find it useful for!


In Detail ğŸ”

  • The plugin will discard versions without description;
  • Due to the way Figma plugins are built, it is not possible to confirm if the message reaches Slack correctly;
  • The plugin is document agnostic, hence the need to input a Document URL;
  • You can only get versions from a file where you have Edit permissions. The plugin will report â€œNo versions foundâ€ for any file you try to access without the right permissions.


â¤ Version History â†’ Slack? Buy me a coffee!

plugins.description:
Find the visual center of any vector shape.


The plugin uses two methods for determining the visual center depending on the shape.


  1. For triangles the plugin will find the centroid to determine visual center.
  2. For vector shapes with more than three vertices the plugin uses the center of the smallest enclosing circle (https://www.nayuki.io/page/smallest-enclosing-circle).


ğŸ‘‰ Usage


  1. Select one or more vector shapes and run the plugin
  2. A guide layer will be added to the page and grouped together with the selected shape.


ğŸ‘‰ Supported Node Types


  • VECTOR
  • STAR
  • RECTANGLE
  • POLYGON
  • ELLIPSE


ğŸ¤” Edge cases


This plugin is not a bulletproof solution to finding the exact visual center. There are still cases in which manual alignment is necessary.

plugins.description:
Join the top brands & agencies using Vizard to scale their creatives.


âœ… Handoff âœ… Personalization at scale âœ… Creative Automation


Designers

Look, we know your time is precious!

You never really like talking to the marketing fellas, do you? They want you to center-align a triangle in a circle, they don't really know what a visual center is!


Vizard lets you keep control of design guidelines while saving you all the time of going back & forth with marketers.


You already handled the developers with Figma/Zeplin, good job! ğŸ‘ Marketers are your last nail in the coffin. This is your true fire & forget!


Features

  • Handoff designs to other stakeholders while keeping your Figma designs intact
  • Seamlessly collaborate with marketers
  • Save your precious time by doing things ONCE!


Now, please skip the next section. Promise?


Marketers

Here is our little secret - We really made Vizard for you! Sssshhh..! We are giving you control to own your assets & the freedom to make unlimited versions of them without bothering the designers. No need to learn a design software & yet be able to generate thousands of variations, on-brand!


Features

  • Scale your design workflow
  • Generate unlimited variations without involving designers
  • No need for design knowledge or extra training


How to use

  1. Sign-up on https://studio.vizardapps.com
  2. Install Vizard Figma Plugin
  3. Select the Frame that you would like to share with the marketing team, run the plugin
  4. (First time only) Click on 'Connect Vizard'. It will open authorization page in browser. Click on 'Authorize Figma'
  5. If the preview looks good, click 'Send to Vizard'. That's it!
  6. The design will be available to you & your marketing team under Your Templates on https://studio.vizardapps.com


Known issues & limitations

  • Mixed styling in text is currently not supported
  • Currently, only Google fonts are supported. All non-google fonts are converted to Fira Sans font
  • Figma Arrow elements get imported as straight lines
  • Only outside stroke is supported. Inside & center strokes get converted to outside strokes


For questions & suggestions, please reach out to us at hello@vizardapps.com


Learn more about Vizard at www.vizardapps.com

plugins.description:
Create voting boxes for your designs. Once created, you can vote on your designs via a button in the sidebar.



How do I vote?

1. Select the nodes to vote on.

2. Run the plugin.

3. Style the boxes to your taste.

4. Select the nodes or boxes and vote via the sidebar.


Who can vote?

Anyone who has write access to your document. Users with read-only access unfortunately cannot vote.


Can I vote from presentation view or put a link into my presentation?

Unfortunately not (yet).


What if someone removes the plugin-section from the sidebar or deletes the box?

You can simply run the plugin on the original node again. The voting score will be recovered.


What will users that don't have the plugin installed see?

Users still see a plugin section in the sidebar, stating 'Install vote'

  •  Configurable â€• Wantedly Preflight has 6+ sophisticated rule and all of them are well-tested. However, in case if you would like to opt-out of some of the rule in your project, you can independently configure items to enable.
  •  Ignore â€• Exceptions are always there. On the result page, you have a check button to ignore the specific node. After you ignored a node, it will always be considered appropriate regardless of whether it violates our rules or not.


Our Design System

See Wantedly UI Components

Here is your first ever ğŸ¥‡ Figma plugin to do video calls with all those interacting into the same Figma file. The Yasou plugin, enables teams that work together on a file to do audio or video calls and run workshops efficiently. Suitable for rapid team communication, share screening, instant feedback and workshops. ğŸ¤™ğŸ¿

Instructions - How to use the Plugin:

Just one from your team has to initiate the plugin:
      1. Install the plugin.
      2. Run the plugin
      3. Enter meeting name and click OK

All the other users in the file like other editors, owners, admins and viewers will then see a generated Image inside the Figma file.
For each one to join the call:

      1. Select the generated image
      2. Join the call by Clicking the Plugin at the bottom right side of Figma.
      3. Enjoy.

Disclaimer: This project is open source and a proof of concept. We are not really sure if it is useful, so we need your opinion. Use it and help us make Yassu even better or hit just us with the hard truth and tell us to drop it.

To give feedback for this plugin, please use this google form right here, anonymously: https://forms.gle/ak7Ki5FBHpnJeHDw8

Learn more about us: www.quintessential.gr
Read our blog: https://medium.com/quintessential-sft
GitHub code: https://github.com/Quintessential-SFT/Yasou-Figma
plugins.name: Yasou - Team Video Calls

plugins.description:
Create, switch and manage as many themes as you need.

Global themes supported, with no need to login anywhere.

Export CSS-variables from theme.

Update all styles within theme at once using Palettes.


Learn how to use this plugin with this Figma Yellowstone Playground


Switch themes ğŸŒğŸŒ›

Plugin switches all colors and effects within selection.

Works for texts with multiple styles.


Create new themes â€” as much as you need ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ¨ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ¨

Duplicate existing theme to create new in just one click. No need to create new styles manually.


Manage themes: rename, update, delete ğŸ§°ğŸ¨

Update themes using Palettes: draw themeâ€™s Palette, change its colors and effects and update entire theme. Try this Figma Yellowstone Playground to learn how to use it.


Use global themes ğŸ“–

Save your libraryâ€™s themes within plugin, load it in another figma file and use. That easy. No need to login anywhere, no need to create any external files or smth.


Export CSS-variables from theme ğŸ“¤

Put css-variables in styles Description once and get ready-to-go code in one click, with any update of your theme.


---


What it does with Local Styles ğŸ’¡

Plugin puts square brackets in style name, to define what theme it belongs to. For example: [Light] / card, [Dark] / card or [Gray] / card.


Of course you can put brackets manually, anywhere, there's no limits: Card [Light], Card / bg [Light], Card [Light] / bg, [Light] / bg â€” its all good. Also, plugin will keep your syntax renaming themes and creating new ones.
plugins.name: Yellowstone â€”Â plugin for themes

plugins.description:
Zebra is a fast, lightweight colour contrast checker.

How to use:
1. Run zebra from the plugin menu
2. Select any two layers that have solid colour fills.
3. View the contrast ratio and WCAG scores for the combination.

If you selecct only one layer zebra will calculate the contrast against white or the last colour you selected. 

It was built as a teaching exercise and the companion tutorial can be found here:
https://medium.com/@danhollick/figma-plugin-tutorial-1-6-65fc2102506
or here:
https://alcohollick.com/writing/figma-plugin-tutorial-1-6/

Zebra is completely open source and the source code is avaialable here:
https://github.com/danhollick/zebra
plugins.name: zebra

plugins.description:
Create customized striped backgrounds in Figma with ease. Zebra lets you design loading bars, inaccessible zones, and much more with few clicks!


Functionalities

  • Two-color striped background creation
  • Angle input for stripes pointing to any direction
  • Width & Height input to adjust the background's size
  • Stripes width input to adjust the stripes width
  • Only a portion of the striped background is visible. If you need to adjust the offset of the stripes, just unlock the background and drag it inside the outer frame.


Future plans

  • Multiple-colored stripes
  • Adjusting the width of individual stripes


Contact

This project is completely open-sourced if you want to see the codebase and help me implement new features, see the GitHub repository. If you have issues with the plugin, create a GitHub issue ğŸ˜‰
plugins.name: Zebra - Striped backgrounds

Play and make Zelda worlds.

To play a world, select it and run this plugin.

To make a world, create a new Frame and drag in the Components from the example world.
plugins.name: Zelda Maker

plugins.description:
Join thousands of users who use Figma and Zeplin together


Stay in design flow, publish finalized designs for development

Go further than specs by publishing finalized designs right from Figma. Developers get locked designs to build from, and you always have control of when versions are published.


A limitless canvas designers love, the structured workspace the team needs

Zeplin is an organized workspace that is friendly to the entire product team. Sections and Tags help the team easily understand designs, no need for extra documentation or design tool training.


Take your design system further than ever before

Extend your design system into the developer world with Zeplin. Showcase reusable components, including Figma Variants. Then, watch them go even further by connecting components to code.


Zeplin provides a design workspace that helps teams deliver on the promise of design. Itâ€™s easy to publish finalized designs, and teams always have clarity on exactly what to build. Collaborating on designs is entirely different in Zeplin, which is accessible & friendly to users without design backgrounds. Scale your design system into the developer world and connect component to code, all with Zeplin.


TO GET STARTED:

  1. Register for a Zeplin account: https://app.zeplin.io/signup 
  2. Download the apps here: https://zpl.io/download-apps
  3. Watch our demo video and publish your first design to Zeplin today! 


ğŸ“š Resources

  • Get Started with Figma Plugin
  • Figma Plugin Troubleshooting Guide


Check out the Design Delivery with Zeplin file for a guided walkthrough, plus tips and tricks to optimize your workflow.


If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at support@zeplin.io.
